Ratings.comment: I think she's a pretty good professor. She will send you emails reminding you of assignments and arE very responsive to emails. The tests were not easy, but definitely not hard if you study for it. Also, there are tons of extra credits that can boost your grade to a next level. Definitely take her class again.

Shucks ( Carrie) is a wonderful Professor. She gave us lots of (6%) extra credits. And you will get more if you participate some Zoom research, which is easy. The book is not mandatory. She will discuss lots of terms in her class. The PPT is clear and covers all the information for the open-notes&book exams. The average score of exam is often 90%.

This class is one of my favorites Ive taken art fisher so far. The class is very interactive and the professor genuinely cares that everyones questions get answer. The class lacks structure but that kinda what I liked about it. Overall this class was pretty easy and there was no stress.

This class has so much potential, but was disappointing. Professor Lewis is caring, but her lectures lacked structure. She did a lot of talking and wanted the class to participate which mostly resulted in awkward silences. The content is not difficult and assignments are easy, just not as interesting as I had hoped going into this class.

I took this class for fun, and it ended up being one of my worst grades due to tough grading. I thought it would be useful but it seems like you showed up to class with no goal or plan each session and just rambled on. Participation is very important, but impossible to pay attention to. Seems to play favorites. Lectures dragged on to no end.

Prof. Keeler has absolutely grown on me. At first she was stern with her policies and practices, but as time went on she has become more flexible and understanding - all it took was some student/teacher communication. Prof Keeler is a really kind person and is more than willing to hear/help her students be successful.

An absolutely horrendous teacher. Focuses on things completely irrelevant to what students need to know, tests are specific, and contradict what she tells you will be on the exam. Tests just test if you do the work, not what you know. Spends minimal time on important content. Extremely passive aggressive and doesnt take feedback well. Huge pass!

worst prof I have ever had in my 19 years of school. She has no industry experience and has never held a job outside of academia and is completely out of touch with how real work environments operate. no The "learning assessments" cover very specific topics that have nothing to do with actually assessing if we are learning. would give 0 if i could.
Good luck.

Professor Keeler is a subjective grader who will test you on specific things like what guest speakers in class talk about. Lectures before class are beyond boring and unhelpful. Points will be taken off on papers for typos & class will always run over. She lacks industry experience hence why guest speakers taught for her. Good luck.

This is the worst professor I have ever had at OSU. He is kind of mean to me, though he's smiling, I can see he doesn't like me. He keeps pausing during lectures to look at his handout. He seems to like to be a knowledgeable professor, but he's not helping on the group project and give useless feedback and limited feedback times.
Quizzes are hard, but you've got to do well or else you'll have to take an even more impossible midtermfinal. He has no real world experience so don't expect real-life examples.

This teacher did cure insomnia as the above rater had said. Everyone in our class would put their head down or be day dreaming. Mid-quarter reviews were unanimous "use voice inflection" he is incredibly monotone which does not help his cause.  Nice guy but will call you out in class if you don't answer correctly.
Such a awful person. Answers no questions. Excellent cure for insomnia though.

zzzzzz...that pretty much sums it up. He posts all the slides online, but you have to attend just to do the 3 in-class assignments and you don't know when he'll collect them. He makes the exams from both lecture and material in the textbook that he does NOT cover in class, so in order to do well on the exams, you need to read the textbooks too!
most boring class ever taken..you will fall asleep while the professor is speaking..i think i've never hated a professor so much..and he is not a fair grader

I ended up feeling sorry for this professor. The class was the most boring I've ever taken in college, and I'm not the type of person to just say that. At one point this quarter, a guy stood up (in the huge Hitchcock Hall lecture room), yelled "THIS IS THE WORST CLASS EVER," and stormed out. Enough said.

This class solidified my decision to drop the Dean's Leadership Academy. There's no doubt that Prof Hu is knowledgeable in her field, but her teaching and grading methods are flawed. Pre-exam review sessions won't serve you very well. She's not very good at giving clear instructions for assignments, which is typically a consequence for your grade.

Professor Noe is an expert in his field and it shines through in his lectures. He is funny and really cares about his students. 
If you have to take his course, reach out to him! He is a great resource and will help you if you show a genuine interest in the class.
One thing I will say is, the weekly assignments do require a fair amount of reading.

Took him for MHRM. He is very funny! He makes lectures easy to follow and enjoys teaching. His first exam is a lot of info and hard to study for, he grades hard. Last exam is easy, but he grades hard. He looks for certain words and phrases that if you don't have it, you miss points. Group project, pretty easy.

Professor Noe has been such a funny professor, that knows how to make somewhat boring material more interesting. He has a great personality and is a very understanding professor if anything ever comes up.

Most disorganized prof ever. Half the time we couldn't figure out what readings to do for class. There were an insane amount of readings (chapters and outdated articles from the 80s and 90s). He was nice enough, but makes you keep track of your participation. So people were talking just to get points, and discussion was always off the rails.

One group project about a Harvard case, one 10-pager (minimum) essay, participation and attendance (pop quizzes), 40% of the lecture grade is factored into your final grade. This is the same for all sections (except pop quizzes), however, thompson is a tough grader for the presentations. Take heidi instead, I would not recommend taking his class.

His lectures are decent, but attendance is not mandatory, so there is pretty much no reason to go to class. The class is made up of 3 exams with no other points, but he offers a couple extra credit opportunities and he outlines how many questions from each chapter and section of the book will be on the exam which is clutch. Take him for sure!

Exams take up 100% of your total grade. No homework, No practice. Class is so boring. Hes a good teacher and cares but this class could not be less appealing. If you dont know definitions or psychology youre bound to not do well

Dr. Thompson could give a lecture on the phone book, and he'd still find a way to make it interesting. Expect an enthusiastic professor with a lot of stories and some great job advice. Very easy guy to talk to. Clearly outlines which topics he'll include on exams. Just study a little bit and you'll do well.
One of my favorite classes taken this year! Really engaging and simple as long as you came to class. Not a lot of outside work if you did work during class.

Grade is based entirely on 3 non-cumulative exams, which are supposed to be based on the lectures but if you really want an A, at least skim the text & know all vocab. Best to create a study guide based on lecture slides, which he just read off of during lecture. He sometimes cancelled class last minute which was frustrating. Do the extra credit!

Take 3200 with someone else! He just read the slides and had no idea what was on the exams (which are the only thing you're graded on). I bought the hardcover book because I study better with the physical thing, then for exam 2 he said that you needed to buy the online text because exam 2 and 3 were administered through McGraw Hill. DISORGANIZED!!!

Dr. Thompson did a good job with this class. Class consisted of one presentation, a final paper, and attendance. Every class had one team presenting and an optional discussion at the end regarding the presentation. I liked the setup of this class and enjoyed the conversations during it. Very relaxed atmosphere and easy to get a good grade.

Very unorganized Professor. Class is graded off of 3 exams only. Accidentally included random information on the second exam so he had to curve it because the average was in the low 60s. Pretty easy class if you study the terms in the textbook, just a really unorganized guy.

Take 3200 with someone else if you can, worst professor by far! Was never prepared for class and grade was only from the exams. Exams had no corelation to the material that was taught, he would just read off the slides and did not give any other information. Class average for second exam was a 60 something I believe.

I had him for recitation and did not care for him. He NEVER responds to emails and takes a very long time to grade papers and presentations. He did not teach at all and he was never really prepared for class. This entire 4490 class is a waste of time and effort, didn't get anything useful out of it besides sitting through 20 min presentations.

Professor Thompson is a wonderful choice for the business senior capstone class. He knows what he is talking about and gives every student a fair chance to grab an A for the class. Everyone should take his class!

Very kind but his lectures are very boring. Very few people show up to them as they are not mandatory. If you study his review slides you will get at least a B on his exams. Just put an ounce of effort and you will succeed.
Really cares about his students. If you study the lecture slides before the exams you'll be fine

He is a very caring guy who cares if his students learn from his class. There are 14 extra credit opportunities where when you show up to class you complete a couple of questions. 3 exams where he tells you which slides to memorize and understand so just work on those and you should do good. Material is pretty common sense and easy to understand
worst professor worst class run away from him

Professor Han barely understands the material he is actually lecturing. The lectures are an hour and a half, yet a good majority of that time is spent talking in circles. The class is weighted out of only 300 points in which is in the form of 3 ridiculous exams.

I love this class so much. John is my favorite professor. The class is structured differently than most I have taken, and I learned about so many aspects that I had never considered before. It was life-changing!
I really love this class so much. Professor Schaffner is a really kind and patient professor. Learn an lot from his class, everyone should take this class!!!

Take this class!! Low-stress/low pressure, Schaffner wants you to feel comfortable coming to/speaking in class. Discussions are facilitated/ encouraged, but you aren't forced to participate. You're allowed to make what you want out of the material. Most caring professor -- wants you to succeed + will talk to you outside of class on his own time

The class overall was disorganized. Meeting times are never confirmed he also does not reply to email, with no proper grading system. The course is lackluster with poor instructions. Grading scale does not make any sense. No separate peer review, just an overall team review so certain students can easily get away with doing absolutely nothing.

Schaffner thinks he is cool and overate himself. Throughout the semester he gave very vague rubric the entire time. Even intentionally discourage you from writing the optional essay which he used as an obstacle for you to enter an A- or A then he won't have a hard time curving overall.  You won't learn real stuff from this class.

John was the best professor I had at OSU, and he sets up his class so that students can decide what they want to learn (within reason). I wish he taught more undergrad classes, I really enjoyed intro to coaching
You're missing out if you haven't taken intro to coaching
Fantastic professor who genuinely cares about his students.

Schaffner is a great professor! Applicable course materials. He pushes you to be better. And he's a great person, so you truly want to make him proud. The readings are interesting (not a typical textbook), and there isn't much work outside of class, but I got so much out of this class!
Great recitation leader for BUSMHR4490! Leads great discussions and is very helpful.
Not a great course.

Dr. Wapner is amazing! Really knows her stuff, fun to talk to, and wants to prepare her students for the real world. She may be a little tougher on some of her grading, but she can back it up with explanations and a clear rubric. Can't recommend her enough

Professor Wapner is an amazing professor. Her class is straight forward. Tests are straight from the power point slides and very high level, and she does her best to make the class interesting. She has several guest speakers and cancels class often. She assisted me with career work outside of her normal class duties. Amazing person to know.
Great guy. Love him!
He turns water into wine.

Dr Lount is a masterful professor.  I thoroughly enjoyed his lectures, his teaching methodologies,  and his efforts to help students even beyond what was required in the classroom.  I would take him again for another subject in a heart-beat.  His lectures were always interesting, and his in class negotiations gave a lot of practical experience.
Professor Lount is really good teacher in fisher. His class is, compared to other classes, interesting.  The exam is not easy, you have to read the text book.  Highly recommend to take his class.
If you are a bad test taker, this class can be challenging, since only 3 midterms will make up your grade.. no homework, quizzes etc. Prof. Lount loves his job and it shows in lecture

Professor Lountâ??s lectures were very clear and almost entertaining.  He uses several film clips and movie excerpts to help demonstrate the topics.  There were several times the entire hall was laughing.  The exams were difficult but fair.  Overall, I would recommend him to anyone taking BUSMHR701. One of the better instructors at Fisher!
Fell asleep almost every class but he is very passionate about HR. Videos made it bearable and extra credit offered. Tests were specific, definitely need the book

Professor Lount is solid. He's passionate about what he teaches. Class is a little boring, but he splices videos in every now and then to keep the content fresh. My only complaint is about some of the overly-specific test questions; if you don't read the book and pick up on minute details, it's easy to miss some of the ones he asks. Still got an A.

The class itself is pretty boring, but Professor Lount is a great teacher.  He's a very clear lecturer and provides his slides online.  There are three exams, non of which are cumulative.  The book helps clear things up, but isn't necessary to do well.  I would definitely recommend him for this class.
He seems like a good guy but the material is just terribly boring. He comes off as a professor type but not snobby in the least bit. He reminds me of the UPS whiteboard guy for some reason.

Prof. Lount is a A+ instructor in Fisher. His lectures are extremely clear and very easy to follow. He knows how to promote himself and makes you trust him (He looks intelligent, confident, and professional). It's true that he usually doesn't make fun of himself; instead, he acts more like a gentleman from Europe. I feel like he's a mystery.

I am not a Human Resources major, but I found this class to be very interesting.  Lecture isn't "mandatory" but he will give you information for the test that you can't find elsewhere. He makes it very clear what is expected of you. Read the book (very easy to read), go to class, study the slides and you will get an  A.

You absolutely are tested on the movies, but they are very easy questions and there are maybe 2 questions for each test.  The books helped a bit, just read the bold print. He does some "grade adjusting" for tests and gives out an easy extra credit assignment.  You are rewarded for sitting through this boring class as he gives hints to the tests.

Prof Lount himself is not a bad guy, but the class is painfully boring.  There are 3-4 in class assignments (surveys) that are given at random times.  That's the only reason to come to class - powerpoints are on carmen. All the videos you watch in class are fun but serve no other purpose b/c tests (3) have no questions about them.

I am not the kind of person to call classes boring, but BUS MHR 400 is the most boring class you can ever take.  Teachers at Fisher don't even try to make it more entertaining and don't realize that it's NOT a business major course. Still a mystery to me how the lecture that has 12 slides and one that has 30 slides can last exact same amount of tim

Professor Ellingson is one of the best professor at Fisher. She is knowledgeable and she is always there to help! Many people complain that they don't know what she expects for assignments but just read through the rubric and you will see what she exactly wants. Go to her office hours. She will give you advice and clarity if you need it.
Interesting class. Was very sweet but got boring very quickly. She's willing to help. Group training project was kind of annoying though.

Most uncomfortable class I have ever been in. She makes instructions for assignments-especially the 35 minute training exercise- completely ambiguous so you haven't a clue what she expects. No help at all.
unnecessary makes the class hard to do well. very unhelpful...
As for enthusiamsm A+ for Hr & psychol As for grading far from it.  As for issues such as alternate time or late work for test or exam don't bother "0"

She makes this class REALLY hard to do well in. Her lectures in class are long and boring and usually they have nothing to do with what you will be tested on. In one class we literally went thru 8 slides in TWO hours.... She is a bit cold and also hard to get help from. She expects A LOT of memorization from the book, which is also extremely boring

I was really excited to take the class but once I found out the class is only out of 100 points I was really let down. The exams and assignments are really hard and she expects you to remember the 500 pages you were supposed to read for the exam. Overall really hard to get an A and if you work your ass off maybe a B.

His rants were hilarious but his assignments are kind of confusing at first. As long as you go on a rant in your paper and say anything during class then you'll be fine. He also wears the exact same outfit to class every day.

I loved this class! Mr. Smith is very intelligent and funny, which made this class enjoyable to attend. Chooses topics that are relevant to the current field of HR and gives us assignments that make us think about how we would handle certain scenarios that may arise once we obtain full time positions. A+

On the plus side, she is very interested in teaching and is very enthusiastic about the subject matter. However, she assigns too much reading, the quizzes are insanely difficult (you need at least 5 people working on them) and her grading is impossible. Makes a would be fun class overwhelming and boring.

Takes the entire class time every single class, never lets you out early.  If you pack up before she is completely done talking she stops the class and tells you to sit down and be quiet like you are a four-year-old.  This class should be an easy A as the material is mostly common sense but the amount of memorization required makes it a lot harder.

I will start out by saying she may be one of the most annoying teachers I have had to sit through.  Not the easiest teacher by any means and the amt of material we need to memorize, ZERO APPLICATION ALL MEMORIZATION, is atrocious.  Holds students to the very last minute of every class and often tell ppl to quiet down and acts like kindergarten tch

Beth comes across as nice, but her arrogance is overwhelming. She believes she knows everything and is at times downright irritable. Extraordinary amount of material for exams, I ended up with an A- but it was my no means easy. If someone questions her reasoning her response is always "I can show you the studies on this." AVOID if possible

Never lets class out early. If you pack up when time is up, she will make the class sit down just to listen to her say goodbye. 2-4 chapters to read per lecture. Overwhelming amount of material to memorize. Keeps the random in-class assignments til' the last 2 weeks of class. Difficult midterms. Makes an easy A a possible C.

Thoroughly enjoyed this class.  The lectures were interesting, and the professor showed enthusiasm in teaching the material.  Very practical stuff for the real world.  I kept up with the readings and studied for the exams and did fine in the class.  I would definitely recommend.

This has to me the most useless lecture of all time. Just reads off the slides and makes you come to class with surprise assignments that she saves until the end of the quarter. Also leaves out info on slides so you attend. Impossible to pay attention. ALWAYS keeps class until the very end. Sometimes past time.

Professor Polin is a wealth of knowledge and is a fantastic teacher for her age. I took her class seriously as this topic is in my field of interest, so I studied hard for her exams and I did quite well! She is also very helpful and understanding. Definitely one the best I've had.

She's not prepared for the materials. The worst exam ever. Almost impossible to get an A. two 65 multiple choices exams. Get at least 120 questions right to clutch an A. She appears to be friendly and generous but once you take her exam, it is the end of the world.

Never ever choose her class! The slides are boring and font is very small. The only thing she knew is putting on the terminologies but failed to clarify them! The book is required and easy to read, but the exam only tests how good your memorization is. The concepts are easy to understand but overwhelmed memorization ruins the test. Poor quality!

Beth is young but knows her stuff! She's nice and willing to help students. Material was communicated well with great examples. Lecture was on PPT slides...a bit long and boring at times. You don't really need the books. There were 3 exams based on the slides and 3 unannounced in-class assignments, which made attendance important. Easy A

Very interesting topics and the exams were relativley easy if you read the chapters. However, Cohn was very disorganized and seemed to just ramble on about stories that had nothing to do with the chapters we were learning about. Does not post grades, so you don't know your grade until they are already posted and finalized.

Best Professor I have ever had. So knowledgable, teaches to all student's learning styles, and makes his lectures interactive and fun. Always prepared for class, play games majority of the time in class. I have never learned more in a class before. Makes learning fun I loved going to class every day.

Professor Rodgers was easily the most organized professor I have had yet. Lectures are optional, yet there are sometimes benefits (exam questions) to going. I really recommend taking this class with him.

Seemed like a nice guy, very approachable at office hours. The content of the class was interesting, but the lectures managed to be way too long and boring. The exams were multiple choice and instead of testing your applied knowledge of the course material, they were all about regurgitating memorized lists and vocabulary from the slides.
it seems he goes to class unprepared. the way he speaks is annoying, he frequently starts sentences with a high pitch sound. His lecture is boring. Class activities are stupid.
His class is useless. His class makes me wanna ask for a refund from the university.

Class wasn't very interesting, but it was fairly easy. The exams (there were 4) were noncumulative, and all the information presented in class was available on Carmen.  A few questions on each exam were over material only presented in the textbook, but they were not substantial in number.

Overall, Dr. Rodgers is one of the better professors I have encountered at OSU.  He was very knowledgeable about the material, which he complimented masterfully with his previous industry experience.  The majority of your grade is based on four non-cumulative exams, which are relatively straightforward if you read the book and attend class.
One of the best professor at Fisher. Very friendly person!!!

The material is just way too much to comprehend. An exam needs memorization of at least 100 terms (i counted them up). Do not take him. Human Resource classes should not be this hard. Btw i'm not lazy at memorization, i got an A on 650. But this professor is just crazy.

Ppl seem to think he's hard.  I thought his class was a breeze.  Gives a study guide that is pretty much exactly whats on the test.  Aced all exams but the final (no cumulative) was pretty hard.  You can probably skip class and still get an A if you read the book and be sure to print off his post lecture slides
Worst professor for BUS555. One of the most easiest course at OSU made ridiculously hard. ALOT of memorization, no learning factor. He's a jerk!
He is extremely hard and you have to MASTER his material just to get a C.  Dont take him.

Avoid him at all cost. Material is very hard and exams are even harder. Will ruin your grade i swear. ALOT of memorization for the class. bad quality professor. Not recommended at all. The other comment is right about 555

This guy should not be teaching at Ohio State. He is extremely hard. 555 is supposed to be an easy, fun course. Other professors are wayyyyy better. Avoid him at all costs. His exams are extremelyyy hard and from the book. He expects you to read lvl 800 stuff for a simple course. He ruined my grade. I regret taking him. spare yourself...He sux!!!!
Great Prof! He's very kind, helpful and approachable. Class is not necessary, but can be fun as it is engaging despite the size.
